TopicTitle: Fanwork Friday: Inspiring The Next Generation

Articles.Content:
<figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_nnby26KbVT1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><figure data-orig-width="1024" data-orig-height="768" class="tmblr-full"><img data-orig-width="1024" data-orig-height="768" src="https://40.media.tumblr.com/314a73601392679907fbed2a45f0f344/tumblr_inline_nnby2dWAKr1rr2wit_540.jpg"/></figure><p> Thane Brimhall sent in his entry for the Kerbal Countdown on

Twitter, and it is nothing short of heart warming and inspiring. With a

boost like this we think he has a very lucky child that can grow up to

accomplish many great things!</p><p> Who or what inspired you to take an interest in KSP?</p>

That is awesome. I would buy that for my nephew.

I had my copy of When We Left Earth over at his house and everytime they would show a picture of a launch he would point at the screen and yell "Rocket!". (Keep in mind he is 2.5 years old) So then I started playing KSP, same thing. Every time I launched, he was so fascinated.

Edited April 24, 2015 by Alshain
So want to give that to my daughter.
I'd buy that and my kids are 6 and 8!

That's cool!

My inspiration was a desire to be an astronaut and an avid interest in space.
Cute
That's pretty awesome!
well where i can let made this childbooks ?
That's outstanding. My kids are a little old for board books now, but a couple years back I would have totally jumped on one of those.

Nice!

Really, a great idea.
Nice! I'd love one so my wife could use it at the daycare she works at.
The Grand Kids would love that! And yeah, I'm that old, but I will play KSP till the day I Die. Before that happens I'll be sure to make them aware of KSP.

I approve of any children's book with the word "inexplicably" in it.

[/totally_serious]
I will get this for my cousin.
I want this for my daughter.
At six days old my newest nephew is a bit young for this but I hope to do the same for him when he's old enough to appreciate it!
I want that and I'm 34.

That is awesome. I would buy that for my nephew.

I would buy that for my nephews, and they are both getting married this year.

(Keep in mind he is 2.5 years old)

Hopefully you train him to tell people he is 2.5 years old, not 2 1/2. Now that's kerbal!
This is going on my 1 year old cousin's bookshelf.

It wasn't inspiring me, but i hoped to inspire someone else:

I made a puzzle for my nephew's birthday. He is five and always wants to play "The funny space game with the green guys".

Here is the image i used (Duna, the Mun and the skybox are edited, obviously)

Hope you guys like it!

Regards,

Lorunification

Where did you get the puzzle made?

LGG

It wasn't inspiring me, but i hoped to inspire someone else:

I made a puzzle for my nephew's birthday. He is five and always wants to play "The funny space game with the green guys".

Here is the image i used (Duna, the Mun and the skybox are edited, obviously)

http://i.imgur.com/isEj5gC.jpg

Hope you guys like it!

Regards,

Lorunification

- - - Updated - - -

If Thane would do a dozen or so more pages, there are places online which would print them for a reasonable price (reasonable given that it would be low quantity, and probably 2-3x the cost of a normal board book)

If paper, would be less.

I'd be happy to help, I've done some self-publishing and know what to do.

LGG

<figure data-orig-width="480" data-orig-height="92" class="tmblr-full"></figure><figure data-orig-width="1024" data-orig-height="768" class="tmblr-full"></figure> Thane Brimhall sent in his entry for the Kerbal Countdown on

Twitter, and it is nothing short of heart warming and inspiring. With a

boost like this we think he has a very lucky child that can grow up to

accomplish many great things!

Who or what inspired you to take an interest in KSP?

Where did you get the puzzle made?

I ordered it at a image print service via internet. I uploaded the picture and they did print it for me. Turned out quite good.

Those little hands are going to shape our future. Let's get them inspired now! I live an hour away from Kennedy Space Center and I love taking my boys, 6 and 12 there. Especially for the Shuttle Launch Experience and the shop. But if I were completely honest, I'd go by myself any day and be like a kid in a candy store. Was fortunate enough to witness the STS-131 launch before they cut the program.
